meanings.sent1: Please prenotify me before you arrive.
meanings.sent2: They always prenotify us about any changes in the schedule.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decided to prenotify the students about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition seemed to prenotify her of the impending danger.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds prenotified the approaching storm.

meanings.definition: The act of notifying in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prenotify was helpful in avoiding any confusion.
meanings.sent2: We received a prenotify about the meeting next week.
meanings.sent3: The prenotify on the bulletin board caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: His sudden silence was a prenotify of his upcoming announcement.
meanings.sent5: The prenotify from the principal made the students excited for the event.
